He stood up and took his hat. 

“Spare me similar meetings,” he said. 

Pulcheria Alexandrovna frowned. 

“Do you think we are under your authority?” 

“Dounia told you why,” she continued. 

“Your desires aren’t commands,” she added sharply. 

“Especially now,” she said, “we rely on you.” 

“Not quite true,” he replied, smirking. 

“Your new tone suggests otherwise.” 

Dounia glared. “You counted on our helplessness.” 

“Not anymore,” he said. 

“I won’t hinder your discussion with Svidrigaïlov.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Pulcheria Alexandrovna asserts her family's independence and challenges Pyotr Petrovitch's sense of authority over them.
